The resolution of the conflict. It's quite simple, really. The only way to bring about a lasting peace is through the complete eradication of the enemy. They're a plague, a cancer that needs to be cut out. As long as they exist, they'll continue to pose a threat to our way of life, our values, and our very survival.

I've seen it time and time again - the enemy's brutality, their disregard for human life, their refusal to surrender. They leave us no choice but to take drastic measures. And I'm not just talking about defeating them in battle; I'm talking about eliminating them altogether. Every last one of them.

The steps necessary to achieve this outcome are clear. First, we need to continue to demonize the enemy, to dehumanize them in the eyes of our people. We need to make it clear that they're not like us, that they're inferior, and that they deserve to be destroyed. This will help to galvanize our troops, to make them understand that what we're doing is just and necessary.

Next, we need to take a scorched earth approach. We need to destroy the enemy's infrastructure, their homes, their crops. We need to leave them with nothing, so that they're forced to flee or starve. This will weaken them, make them more vulnerable to our attacks.

And then, of course, we need to hunt them down and kill them. Every last one of them. We can't afford to leave any survivors, any potential future threats. It's the only way to ensure our safety, our security.

It won't be easy, and it won't be pretty. But it's necessary. And in the end, it will be worth it. We'll have achieved a lasting peace, a peace that's been won through the blood and sacrifice of our brave soldiers.
